abstract: BHP Billiton, the world’s largest mining company, has revived plans for a $40 billion (£20.2 billion) takeover of Alcoa, according to The Times of London. The newspaper, without citing any named sources, said BHP is in the early stages of evaluating the merits of a takeover. BHP, based in Melbourne, “is not thought to have” formally approached Alcoa, the Times reported.
